titleStmt.title: An elegie upon the truly worthy, and ever-to-be-remembred loyal gentleman, Captain Will. Bedlow, Englad's [sic] deliverer, and the scourge of Rome: who departed this life on the 22 of this instant August; to the great grief of all true Protestants. With an account of his pious end.

notesStmt.note: Verse: "Alas! what sullen fate has hence convey'd (stay'd" ...
Within mourning borders, with emblems and motto.
Reproduction of original in the British Library.
